results.title: Buffy. Season 1. Eps 01-12 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Starting life as a moderately successful feature film, “Buffy the vampire slayer” has become a cultural phenomena, spawning thousands of fan sites, a spin-off TV series (Angel), numerous theoretical journals and even it’s own language (Buffy speak). Sixteen year old Buffy Summers (Sarah Michelle Gellar), a typical teenage girl in every respect except one, (she has been destined to slay vampires) moves to Sunnydale, California with her divorced mum. What she is unaware of however is that Sunnydale was built above the ‘hellmouth’, an evil dimension rife with demons and vampires. Buffy reluctantly finds herself burdened with slayer duties again while she struggles to fit into her new high school, date guys and get her homework done. Geller holds her own as the blonde wise cracking, ass-kicking vampire killer but creator Joss Whedon also surrounds her with a strong supporting cast that well and truly hold their own. The ‘Scooby gang’ as they have come to be known consist of computer geek Willow (Alyson Hannigan), the goofy Xander (Nicholas Brendan), the snobby Cordelia (Charisma Carpenter), Buffy’s watcher Gile’s (Anthony Stewart Head) and the brooding vampire with a soul and Buffy love interest, Angel (David Boreanaz). The pleasures in Whedon’s series comes out of the clever play with adolescent angst where every minor humiliation is tantamount to Armageddon and that sometimes it really is. Season one finds Buffy and the Scooby gang battling the Master, an ancient vampire determined to open up the hellmouth and literally create hell on earth. All this and Buffy still has to survive high school.

results.title: Buffy. Season 6. Part 2. Eps 12-22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joss Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season six of Joss Whedon’s cult series is predominately the bleakest one of them all. The ‘Scooby gang’ are all in the throes of relationship hell. Willow (Alyson Hannigan) and Tara’s (Amber Benson) love for each other begins to erode as Willow falls deeper into the black arts (addiction metaphors abound in this season), while Xander (Nicholas Brendon) and Anya (Emma Caulfield) experience pre-wedding jitters with catastrophic consequences (Hell’s bells Eps. 116). Not to mention the fact that Buffy, the vampire slayer, starts this season dead and buried (Bargaining 1&2 Eps. 101 & 102). Considering how downbeat this season is, surprisingly it’s the one with the most light and comical villains, the nerdy three, Jonathan, Andrew and Warren (Flooded Eps. 104) - not to mention that they are mere mortals. It’s also the season that Buffy went musical (Once more with feeling Eps. 107), a Joss Whedon directed episode that proves once and for all how inventive and original this show can be. Buffy’s resurrection (you didn’t think she was going to stay dead did you!) proves to be the season’s overriding story arch as she grapples with being flesh once again and the dire consequences that entails. One of them being a destructive and highly sexual relationship with resident bad boy vampire, Spike (James Marsters).

results.title: With Bernadette in Papua New Guinea
results.creator_credit: David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Focuses n the life of a young girl living in a village in Papua-New Guinea. Shows the customs of the people living the village, the schooling system, the working of garden plots, and the communal effort of the villagers constructing buildings such as an extension for the school.

results.title: Buffy the vampire slayer
results.creator_credit: Gareth Davies and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: For as long as there has been vampires, there’s been the slayer - one girl, hand picked out of the entire world as championing the cause against the creatures of the night. Join Buffy, Giles, Willow, Zander, Cordelia and Angel as they struggle to keep Sunnydale - town at the hellmouth, free from all that is evil, while still mainaining a killer sense of humour and a savvy sense of fashion.

results.title: With Bekus in Nepal
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer, Andrew Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the life style of the people in a village in Nepal by focussing in particular on Bekus, a thirteen year old boy. Highlights the village blacksmith, the mill, a Hindu wedding and village musicians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail Singer, Andrew Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions

results.title: Visions of Victoria
results.creator_credit: Stewart Faichney and Janne Martin Video Productions
results.brief_description:
On a continent distinguished for its unique mixture of climates and for its exotic wildlife, there is no state that provides more variety and contrast than Victoria. Occupying the south-east corner of Australia, and only slightly larger than the size of Great Britain, Victoria has something for everybody. This video takes you on a remarkable tour of the state of Victoria which includes the wilderness areas of its world famous national parks, some of the best surf beaches in the world, Australia’s largest inland lagoon system, a rugged shipwrecked coast, winter resorts and high country, wetlands and even deserts. Also the vibrant and sophisticated city of Melbourne, renowned for its beautiful parks and gardens, exciting restaurants and nightlife, its devotion to the arts and, of course, a fanatical love of sports of all kinds. This superb video is a comprehensive celebration of this wonderful state, in all its beauty, seasons and moods.

Note: the end has a segment on film classification showing Bill Collins introducing the “G” rating.

results.title: Witchfinder General
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Philip Waddilove, Arnold Louis Miller and Louis M Heyward
results.brief_description: The sinister subject of this film becomes apparent in the opening scene, where shots of an old woman being dragged, screaming, through the streets of a village are juxtaposed against those of a lone figure calmly tending the gallows on a barren, windswept hilltop. It is 1645, and England is in the grip of civil war. As law and order collapses, and unrest plagues the populace, cries of witchcraft begin to echo across the land. Soldier Richard Marshall (Ian Ogilvy) finally gains permission from John Lowes, the priest of Branderston, to marry his niece, Sara (Hilary Dwyer), as long as he promises to take her away to another village. As Richard returns to his regiment, Matthew Hopkins (Vincent Price) and his sadistic assistant, John Stearne, ride into town, seeking a priest who allegedly worships Satan. John Lowes is tracked down and tortured, until Hopkins lays eyes on Sara, and agrees to suspend the death sentence if Sara allows him to come to her bed-chamber and “question her”. In exchange for her uncle’s life, Sara agrees, and all is well until one night Stearne follows Hopkins to her home and learns why the priest has received a reprieve. While Hopkins is away on business in the neighbouring town, Stearne corners Sara and rapes her. One of the men who accused John Lowes of idolatry misinterprets the nature of this attack and tells Hopkins, who, in a fit of jealousy, orders the torture and death of her uncle. Richard hears of these hangings, and deserts the army in order to be by his bethrothed’s side. Standing in the midst of the ruined church, he marries Sara in a mock ceremony, and vows to avenge both her and her uncle by killing Hopkins and Stearne. Matthew Hopkins, menacingly brought to life by legendary actor Vincent Price, was a real-life witch-hunter who operated in the era of English general and Puritan statesman, Oliver Cromwell. This film, the last by director Michael Reeves before his untimely death in 1969, was such a great success (despite its low budget), that it spawned a number of imitators, including the horror classic, “The Bloody Judge” (1969).

results.title: Visions of light
results.creator_credit: Todd McCarthy, Stuart Samuels, Arnold Glassman, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: The premise of this wonderfully engaging documentary is simple: sit a number of the world’s best cinematographers in front of a camera for a change, have them talk about their work on some of the enduring classics of world cinema, excerpt clips to illustrate what they are talking about, and ask them to cite some of their influences. What results is completely hypnotic, especially for anyone who knows anything about the movies and wants a glimpse of what goes into getting them made. This documentary will leave you wishing that it was at least twice as long!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Todd McCarthy, Stuart Samuels, Arnold Glassman, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and American Film Institute

results.title: Witches' brew
results.creator_credit: Herbert L. Strock, Richard Shorr, Donna Ashbrook and Joshua Lightman Company
results.brief_description: A mesmerising tale of magic, power struggles and betrayal. Margaret, Linda and Susan are three housewives using witchcraft to further the careers of their husbands. When Margaret’s husband Joshua jeers at her claims that her magic has enhanced his life, she decides to teach him a lesson by removing her spells and renouncing her “hobby”. Soon after, Joshua experiences an amazing run of bad luck, heightened by the evil intentions of Linda and Susan, who have their own reasons for eliminating him. Margaret’s only hope seems to be the head witch, Vivian, played by screen veteran Lana Turner, but does she want to help, or does she have an ulterior motive? Filmed as a black comedy send up of the British film, “Burn, Witch, Burn” (1962), and adapted from Fritz Leiber’s novel, “Conjure Wife”.
